intro: Allium pulchellum var. calabrum, commonly known as the Calabrian garlic or wild garlic, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is characterized by its rosette of narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, white to pale purple flowers in clusters. The plant belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is often found in rocky or open woodland areas. It is valued for its aromatic leaves and bulbs, which are used in cooking and traditional medicine. Its botanical features make it a hardy, perennial plant that thrives in well-drained soils.
